snippet: Talks about a collaboration in slowing the flow of migrants, gathering intelligence and tracking militants have stalled amid mutual distrust.
abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris spur European Union leaders to consider concessions requested by Turkish government, including euro payments, visa-free travel and EU membership, during negotiations aiming at tightening of Turkey’s porous land and maritime borders.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul; Dan Bilefsky from Paris; James Kanter from Brussels; Tim Arango from Essex Junction, Vt.; and Elisabeth Malkin and Azam Ahmed from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Talks about a collaboration in slowing the flow of migrants, gathering intelligence and tracking militants have stalled amid mutual distrust.

headline.main: Turkey’s Role as Migrant Gateway Is Source of New Urgency for E.U.
headline.print_headline: Turkey’s Role as Migrant Gateway Is Source of New Urgency for E.U.
